intro: Pectis polycephala, commonly known as the many-headed pectis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or perennial herb, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its distinctive feature is the arrangement of numerous small flower heads that give it a bushy appearance. Pectis polycephala is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique foliage and floral display.
